summary: EPyT-Flow vulnerable to unsafe JSON deserialization (__type__)
details:
### Impact
EPyT-Flowâ€™s REST API parses attacker-controlled JSON request bodies using a custom deserializer (my_load_from_json) that supports a __type__ field. When __type__ is present, the deserializer dynamically imports an attacker-specified module/class and instantiates it with attacker-supplied arguments. This allows invoking dangerous classes such as subprocess.Popen, which can lead to OS command execution during JSON parsing. This also affects the loading of JSON files.

### Patches
EPyT-Flow  has been patched in 0.16.1 -- affects all versions <= 0.16.0

### Workarounds
Do not load any JSON from untrusted sources and do not expose the REST API.

### Credits
EPyT-Flow  thanks Jarrett Chan (@syphonetic) for detecting and reporting the bug.
